content: Hi, anyone have an idea when applications for the Adjoint School will open?

I haven't seen any official information on the Adjoint School. The organizing committee consists of Sophie Libkind, David Jaz Myers, Angeline Aguinaldo, and Elena di Lavore, while the steering committee consists of Brendan Fong and Daniel Cicala. So these would be the people to ask.
If you find out anything, please put the information here.
One other thing I know is that Spencer Breiner and Joe Moeller are serving as mentors for one of the courses, which will probably be on thermodynamics and category theory.
Thank you @John Baez , you're always incredibly helpful :)

Thanks so much for your interest @Sean Gloumeau! We are still gathering our team of mentors for the 2022 school, and I expect that we'll open the applications at the end of December or beginning of January.

Yes, there definitely will be a flurry of advertising when the time comes!

Applications for the Applied Category Theory 2022 Adjoint School are now open!

This is the fifth edition of the research school adjoint to the Applied Category Theory annual conference.

The Adjoint School aims to

  • Foster an open-hearted and open-minded environment where new applied category theorists develop the skills of research,
  • Welcome new researchers into cutting-edge research programs in applied category theory, and
  • Grow and strengthen the applied category theory community.

The school has two components: a reading component, where participants read papers and meet virtually to present on them over the course of a few months (February to June), and a research component where participants meet with established researchers to work on a project together during the week of July 11-15 hosted at the University of Strathclyde in Glasgow (UK). Please note that this meeting might be hybrid depending on the pandemic situation.

This yearâ€™s mentors and research projects are:

  • @Spencer Breiner and @Joe Moeller - Compositional Thermodynamics
  • @Paige North - Fuzzy Type Theory for Opinion Dynamics
  • Nicoletta Sabadini - A Compositional Theory of Timed and Probabilistic Processes: CospanSpan(Graph)
  • @Filippo Bonchi - Algebraic Structures in Logic and Relations

We will consider advanced undergraduates, PhD students, post-docs, as well as people working outside of academia. Members of groups which are underrepresented in the mathematics and computer science communities are especially encouraged to apply.

More information about the projects can be found at adjointschool.com/2022 and then start your application at adjointschool.com/apply.

Application deadline: Saturday, January 29, 2022.

Thanks from the organizers,
@Angeline Aguinaldo, @Elena Di Lavore , @David Jaz, and @Sophie Libkind

I fail to understand how it would be possible to write down a decent application for this track in only two days.

I had forwarded the link to some of my peers and they said exactly this - Especially because the referee is supposed to comment on the relevance to applicant's research.

In any case, if everyone shares my belief that deadlines should be postponed, I'd suggest to avoid further problems by announcing it asap (that is, not on the 29th, after many people will have already submitted badly drafted applications in a hurry)

We're grateful to have already received many excellent applications for all of the projects, but we do want to make sure all applicants have a chance to put their best foot forward. That being said...

We are extending the application deadline to next Friday, February 4, anywhere on earth. We really appreciate everyone's patience, and we're looking forward to a great Adjoint School! If any applicants have specific questions or concerns, message me, or email the adjoint school at actadjointschool@gmail.com
We'll do another round of advertising and get in touch with everyone who submitted a pre-application to make sure the word gets around!
